channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Promised Americans Booming Wealth. Now He’s Changing His Tune.
item.description: President Trump’s sweeping promises are running headlong into the reality of governing.

item.title: Trump declares Tesla boycott ‘illegal’ and vows to buy a new car from Elon Musk in solidarity
item.description: A pressure campaign targeting Trump's wealthy political patron is conspiratorial and against the law, the president told his supporters, despite boyco...

item.title: Exclusive: Former JPMorgan digital asset chief raises $3 million to transform real estate with blockchain technology
item.description: Arda hopes to create a platform that aggregates data about real estate transactions and property management.

item.title: Hundreds of Civilians in Syria Take Shelter at Russian Air Base
item.description: Footage and satellite images reviewed by The Times show civilians in the compound. Thousands have fled violent unrest in the country’s coastal region.

item.title: What Covid Taught Us
item.description: We look at how the world changed — and what studies revealed about how we live.

item.title: Solar Energy, Criticized by Trump, Claims Big U.S. Gain in 2024
item.description: The added capacity for the year was the most from any single source in more than two decades.

item.title: Why the founder of $250 million vitamin and supplement brand Ritual is urging Congress to regulate her own industry
item.description: Ritual founder Katerina Schneider is asking Congress to regulate the supplement industry, despite HHS Secretary RFK Jr.'s support for alternative medi...

item.title: Unilever’s new CEO wants to make the Dove soap maker popular with influencers as a ‘machine of content creation’
item.description: “I don’t have any emotional engagement with any brand when it comes to portfolio management,” Unilever CEO Fernando Fernandez said.

item.title: European markets hold steady as U.S. trade tensions and recession fears rattle global markets
item.description: London's stock market dipped in morning deals Tuesday, while Paris and Frankfurt edged higher, helped by gains for infrastructure and defense stocks.

item.title: Philippines’ Ex-President Duterte Arrested Under I.C.C. Warrant
item.description: Rodrigo Duterte, the former Philippine president, was arrested on Tuesday in Manila and was to be flown to The Hague to face International Criminal Co...

item.title: Ukraine and U.S. Talks on War Begin as Gulfs Remain
item.description: American and Ukrainian representatives are meeting in Saudi Arabia, but the United States, Ukraine and Russia envisage very different paths to peace.

item.title: One Person Missing After Oil Tanker and Container Ship Collide in the North Sea
item.description: A container ship hit a stationary U.S.-flagged oil tanker on Monday, forcing the crews to abandon ship. A search for a missing crew member ended Monda...

item.title: Ukraine Targets Moscow With Large-Scale Drone Attack
item.description: The assault, which the mayor called the largest on Russia’s capital since the war began, was a reminder of Ukraine’s power to strike as its president ...
